title: Ticket #1438: Addition of skip_filechecks to condor_submit language
description:
skip_filechecks provides the writer of a submit file control over the checks condor_submit will perform on files, such as input and output. It allows fine-grain control that was previously only available in configuration via SUBMIT_SKIP_FILECHECKS or on the command line via condor_submit's -disable flag. For example, if it is desirable to have condor_submit verify the existence of input files for only one job the following can be done, 

executable = EXE
input = input_that_must_already_exist
queue
skip_filechecks = true
input = input_that_will_exist
queue

This is also useful for users of DAGMan, where it is not possible to tell DAGMan to pass -disable to condor_submit and disabling all filechecks via SUBMIT_SKIP_FILECHECKS is either infeasible or undesirable.
